metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17185 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In FreeRADIUS 3.0.x before 3.0.20, the EAP-pwd module used a global OpenSSL BN_CTX instance to handle all handshakes. This mean multiple threads use the same BN_CTX instance concurrently, resulting in crashes when concurrent EAP-pwd handshakes are initiated. This can be abused by an adversary as a Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-common - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-config - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-dhcp - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-iodbc - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-krb5 - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-ldap - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-memcached - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-mysql - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-postgresql - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-redis - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-rest - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-utils - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
freeradius-yubikey - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
libfreeradius3 - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.2').
